com.raweng.built

Class BuiltRole

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.raweng.built.BuiltObject
      • com.raweng.built.BuiltRole

  • public class BuiltRole
extends BuiltObject
    To create, modify or delete roles on Built.io Backend server. Roles are a sort of group containing users and other roles. So instead of giving permission to each user, could instead add those users to and assign permissions to the role. All users in the role would inherit permissions that the role receives.
    Author:
    built.io. Inc

      • configure

        public BuiltRole configure(JSONObject jsonObject)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates new instance of BuiltRole from valid JSONObject.
        Overrides:
        configure in class BuiltObject
        Parameters:
        jsonObject - JSONObject instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception -

        Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltRole role = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").role();

 role.configure(jsonObject);

      • getRolesQuery

        @Deprecated
public BuiltQuery getRolesQuery()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Deprecated. 
        Provides BuiltQuery object to retrieve application roles. Note :- This method returns an object of BuiltQuery class, all the methods of the BuiltQuery class are available and can be used to query the "Application User Role" class of Built.io Backend.
        User can get list of BuiltRole objects using QueryResult.getRoles() in success callback of BuiltQuery.exec(QueryResultsCallBack) method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception -

        Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltRole role = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").roleWithName("Manager");
        
 BuiltQuery roleQuery = role.getRolesQuery();

 userList.add(user);

 role.addUsers(userList);

      • hasUser

        public boolean hasUser(java.lang.String userUid)
        Whether the user is present in this role.
        Parameters:
        userUid - userUid - To check with.
        Returns:
        returns true, if user exists in this role else returns false.

        Example :
         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 //'blt8h2sample1463j' is a dummy role uid
 BuiltRole role = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").roleWithName("Manager");
        
 if(role.hasUser("bltba9userdd9e741")){
     //User is exist.
 }else{
     //User is not exist.
 }

      • hasRole

        public boolean hasRole(java.lang.String roleUid)
        Check whether role with specified name exists in application.
        Parameters:
        roleUid - role uid.
        Returns:
        returns true if role is exists else returns false.

        Example :
         //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 //'blt8h2sample1463j' is a dummy role uid
 BuiltRole role = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").roleWithName("Manager");
        
 if(role.hasRole("blt8h2sample1463j")){
     //Role is exist.
 }else{
     //Role is not exist.
 }
